item.text: Short Title of the Research Study intended for the lay audience
IRB number assigned by the site institution
The primary site investigator to contact
First or given name associated with the site principal investigator
Surname or family name associated with the site principal investigator
Suffix such as Junior (Jr.), Senior (Sr.), I, II, III, IV, etc. associated with the site principal investigator's name
Professional and Academic degrees associated with the site principal investigator
Media of any type used as part of a participant recruitment strategy.
The distribution of audio or video content to a dispersed audience via any electronic mass communications medium.
Audio or video content to a dispersed audience via any electronic mass communications medium
A contiguous sound recording used to relay audible information.
Short clips of video, usually part of a longer recording. Sometimes used to mean any short video.
A contiguous segment of audio broadcasting airtime.
A contiguous segment of video broadcasting airtime.
Materials produced by printers or publishers, such as books, magazines, booklets, brochures, newspaper.
A large outdoor advertising space designed to capture the attention of motorists and pedestrians.
A small book or magazine that contains images and information about a company or organization's products and/or services.
A small piece of paper with information on it about a product or event
A periodical publication containing articles and illustrations.
Letters and packages conveyed by the postal system.
A printed publication (usually issued daily or weekly) consisting of folded unstapled sheets and containing news, feature articles and advertisements.
A message by mail without an envelope.
A large printed picture, photograph, or notice that you stick or pin to a wall or board, usually for decoration or to advertise something.
A self-standing promotional unit created from printed and folded card stock for table tops.
Computer-based technology that facilitates the sharing of ideas and information and the building of virtual networks and communities.
Messages distributed by electronic means from one computer user to one or more recipients via a network.
An online platform that allows users to create a public profile and interact with other users on the website.
A digital audio file made available on the internet for download to a computer or mobile device. Typically available as a series.
A computer-based technology that facilitates the sharing of ideas and information and the building of virtual networks and communities.
A form of advertising on the World Wide Web embedded in a web page.
A form of advertising on the Word Wide Web delivered by an ad server.
Communication posted for public viewing or an electronic message sent to & displayed on an online forum.
A page or collection of pages on the World Wide Web that contains specific information which was all provided by one person, group or an organization
Will Direct Communication Materials be Utilized?
Communication addressed to a specific person.
Involves a person's physical presence rather than communication by phone, email, etc.,
A written, typed, or printed communication, especially one sent in an envelope by mail or messenger:
A communication or conversation by phone.
Will Group Communication Materials be Utilized?
Communication addressed to a defined group of people.
An ad that may take many different forms. It could be a banner, a graphic image or an animated GIF of a designated pixel size and byte size.
A website or web page where users can post comments about a particular issue or topic and reply to other users' postings.
Communication issued periodically to the members of a society, business, or organization.
A scholarly journal addressed to a particular professional audience such as doctors, teachers or engineers and published by a professional organization.
A publication that containing the latest information/tips/predictions for a particular business or stock market information or horse racing results, etc.
Will Public Communication Materials be Utilized?
A public and typically formal statement about a fact, occurrence, or intention.
A written statement about a matter of public interest which is given to the press by an organization concerned with the matter.
A method of communication involving asking for or trying to obtain something from someone in public.
A technique among social scientists who wish to work with a population that is difficult to identify or locate.
Resource ID of the parent Questionnaire Response, if any
Resource ID for the Research Study associated with the parent Questionnaire Response, if any
Resource ID of the local considerations Questionnaire Response, if any
